title: Major Cocaine Seizures (25kgs+) San Luis Potosi
name: Major Cocaine Seizures (25kgs+) San Luis Potosi
description: This data shows the major cocaine seizures (25kgs +) in San Luis Potosi, Mexico from 09/15/2011 to 12/14/2011.

properties.security operations specs: The article does not specify tactics.
properties.bid: 10/16/2011: On Sunday, at a house located in Baltazar Echave Orio Street,  in Anaya Housing Estate, in San Luis Potosi, San Luis Potosi, Mexico,  the 34th Infantry Battalion personnel arrested Pedro Pablo Serrano-Medina and Juana del Carmen Flores-Avalos for being in possession of drugs. Military personnel seized five plastic bags containing over 634 kilograms of crack cocaine, two cellular phones, 18 plastic bag sealer machines, two electric scales, 23 gram scales, assorted bags of different sizes and colors, and one gray Chevrolet Equinox truck.  Military personnel searched the residence after arresting Jonathan Ivan Gallegos-Rodriguez for crack cocaine possession. Rodriguez led authorities to the house.
properties.opinfo: 34th Infantry Battalion personnel arrested two individuals and seized evidence.

properties.security operations specs: The individuals were stopped at a security checkpoint, where their vehicle failed to pass the gamma ray inspection.
properties.bid: 09/27/2011: On Tuesday, at kilometer marker 60 on Camino Nacional 57 Mexico-Piedras Negras, on the stretch of San Luis Potosi-Nunez, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, two individuals driving a white 2004 Freightliner with Veracruz license plate XR7497 pulling a 2009 Ferry flat bed with Federal Public Service license plate 586UM failed a gamma ray inspection at a security checkpoint. Federal police officers detained the two individuals after they found 115 packages of cocaine, weighing 125.355 kilograms in a hidden compartment in the tractor trailer. The vehicle was taken apart in search for drugs at the 12th Military Zone base. The detainees were identified as 45-year-old Felipe Martinez-Alvarez, "Cochi" and 21-year-old Jessica Contreras Enriquez. The two were travelling with a 10-month-old baby.
properties.opinfo: Federal Police arrested the two individuals at the checkpoint.

properties.security operations specs: Police used a XZ Backscatter Van (ZBV) in the operation.
properties.bid: 11/18/2011: On Friday, in San Luis Potosi, Mexico, federal police searched an omnibus with a XZ Backscatter Van (ZBV) located at kilometer marker 60 of the Mexico-Piedras Negras highway. The ZBV detected irregular forms leading to an inspection near the back tires. Twenty three packages of cocaine were found which weighed a total of 25 kilos. Authorities arrested the conductor and his accomplice. Nineteen other passengers were put onto another bus and were allowed to continue traveling.The omnbibus was a 2003 Volvo.
properties.opinfo: Federal Police were involved in the operation.

properties.security operations specs: Police used x-ray technology to find the drugs.
properties.bid: 11/01/2011 (default date): On Tuesday, on the Nacional highway Piedras Negras, San Luis Potosi-Nunez section, San Luis Potosi, Mexico, a passenger bus headed toward Matamoros, Tamaulipas, was stopped after x-ray equipment was used with a Vacis gamma ray to inspect it. Federal Police personnel, participating in Punto de Atencion Carretera, in the Inspection Service and Security and Surveillance part of the Regional Security Division, found forty packages of cocaine with a weight of 48 kilos and 232 grams were seized from a hidden compartment in the bathroom.
properties.opinfo: Federal Police personnel, participating in Punto de Atencion Carretera, in the Inspection Service and Security and Surveillance part of the Regional Security Division were involved in the operation.
